results.title: Proud years
results.creator_credit: George C. Stoney and Potomac Films
results.brief_description: Shows steps that can be taken to help old people to lead active, useful lives; explores the daily problems of old age and discusses the problems that arise from needless inactivity in old age.
results.description: Shows steps that can be taken to help old people to lead active, useful lives; explores the daily problems of old age and discusses the problems that arise from needless inactivity in old age.

results.title: Proud ships: A glimpse of the Shell tanker at work
results.creator_credit: Philip Armitage and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: One-fifth of the merchant ships afloat consists of tankers which form a floating chain between the oilfields of the world and the consumer. The film centres round a single tanker - the “Liparus” - on her normal run, introducing her officers and some of her crew. The modern takner is a large and handsome vessel and special care is devoted to ensuring good living conditions for officers and men. Because of possible danger there is a fixed routine of weekly boat drill, and fire-drills are taken seriously. As a result tankers are “the best bet there is on the insurance market”.

results.title: Protozoa: one-celled animals
results.brief_description: Dr Roman Vishniac, scientist and microphotographer, identifies pseudopods, flagelettes, and ciliates, showing how they move, eat and reproduce. Provides examples of symbiosis, parasitism, and colonial organisations.

results.title: Protist reproduction (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bruce J. Russell and Biomedia Associates
results.brief_description: Shows a sexual reproductive methods of protists, including fission, with replication of organelles and subcellular particles, specialised forms of budding (in suctorians) conjugation in ciliates and algae and the production of eggs and sperm by colonial protists.

results.title: Protein structure and functions
results.brief_description: The film shows that life requires protein as a structure to maintain it and as a catalyst for the system of chemical reactions necessary for life. Shows the molecular structure of protein and its function. Presents protein as a polymer of amino acids and shows that amino acid side chains determine the structural configuration and chemical or enzymatic activity of protein.

results.title: Prospectus for growth
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how the investment of foreign capital contributes to the economic development of traditionally agricultural countries by promoting the growth and diversification of industry. It shows how capital investment from the United States has made possible improvemnets in the standard of living in Latin America, the Near East and Far East.

results.title: Prospecting for petroleum
results.creator_credit: Duke Goldstone, George Pal and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: An account of man’s never-ending search for oil. Opens with a dramatized survey of the importance of oil in modern industrial economy, followed by an account of how oil is formed in the earth’s crust. Methods used by early oil prospectors are compared with the magnetic gravimetric and seismic surveys used in the modern search for oil. An animated film.

results.title: Prospect for a city
results.creator_credit: Henry Cooper, Alan Harper and Harper Films
results.brief_description: Edinburgh is an outstanding example of a planned city and this film was made to mark the bi-centenary of the plans of the first architect, James Craig. Today modern ideas of town planning are being incorporated in the old city of squares and vistas.
